Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Bozidar2012
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very center of Istanbul, just a few meters from Istiklal street and Taksim square. Many shopping opportunities near hotel and opposite are also few cheap restaurants with Turkish specialties. The breakfast was very good. The hotel can be recommended

Reviews.Title: “great breakfast and restaurant view”
Reviews.Author: sai-amr
Reviews.Content: the most remarkable thing is the breakfast, it has lots of variety and the restaurant is very cozy and has a nice view, the rooms are small but clean and comfy, make sure to get a bosphorus view, the location is more than gr8 just a few steps from istiklal street *where the main night life exists and lots of shopping and also few steps from taksim square, staff is polite and helpful. we r planning on our nxt trip to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the city ,very nice Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: YoussefSudan
Reviews.Content: very good breakfast with nice different varieties ,very good staff , excellent location close to all transportation facilities , room was clean but very small

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room view but the hotel need recontruction”
Reviews.Author: MarouGreece
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 3-4 minutes to the Taxsim Square and so you are in the middle of the city! The area is not dangerous and you can go wherever you want as there is a metro station and busses stations close to the hotel. The airport bus is 5-10 minutes walk. The hotel is very old and need to be reconstructed. The room was ok but not clean enough and certainly not worth the 120â‚¬ per day, but the view to the Bosphorous sea was marvelous!!! The breakfast was sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: mnasry
Reviews.Content: hotel is quite , Clean , Staff are frindly ,, Very close to taksim Hotel A/C needs to be more power

Reviews.Title: “very very baaaaaaaaaaad hotel”
Reviews.Author: revoli
Reviews.Content: i cant sleep there is no cool air condetion its terrible i changed my room 3 times during 12 hours i advice any one to dont come to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel and well located”
Reviews.Author: Susana1812
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this hotel. People there were very nice. Excellent indoor pool and Turkish bath. Located at Taksim Square, from where you can go anywhere. I recommend it! I spent a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “In fact it is - really ok.”
Reviews.Author: Croatia_ZG
Reviews.Content: For all of those writing all kind of comments and for those reading it and thinking - this is a dump, you are completely wrong. Marble hotel is in face exactly what you are paying for. It is neither a dump nor a deluxe resort. Firstly, i've stayed in Marble, Grandstar, Nippon, Grand Oztanik and few other hotels several times during last few years privately and business wise, so i know what i am talking about. Main thing that you have to keep in mind when booking Marble is - location. Probably the best in Istanbul. That is if you are interested in walking through city's artery Istiklal, do a little shopping, try some bars, see people and enjoy some nightlife. If you just want to only see culture & visit city attractions and after that rest in your hotel withour trying some restaurants, bars, nargile or other things Istanbul is famous for, go somewhere else. But keep in mind that there is literaly NOTHING to do after nighfall. Regarding Marble and good side of staying there, location is great with everything in just few steps from hotel (taxi, tobacco, good food, money exchange, bars, shops, restaurants, Istiklal street), view is nice (if you book Bosphorus view), breakfast is little bit "stronger" then before so it is fair enough, hotel even has parking free for guests (which is good in this part of the town). Some rooms do look little bit worn out, but for the price you are paying - come on. I've stayed in all kind of rooms there, and generally, hotel is ok. Some rooms facing Siraselviler Cadessi can be noisy due to Turkish need to horn & play loud music in their cars, specially during weekend. So, when booking it, ask for a room on upper floors of the hotel. If you are a normal person that needs a normal, clean room where you will spend few hours sleeping after wondering around the town whole day, then Marble is your choice. If you're looking for some place where you will enjoy your free time, relax in a big hotel lobby or whatever similar, then book some other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average & accepted Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Uschi-Cairo
Reviews.Content: I stayed there a week and went to my room only for sleeping. It is an acceptable moderate hotel, but not as a 4 star Hotel as I was told by my travel agency. The rooms were clean & tidy, but the towels and bed sheets were old and sometimes ripped off. AC was horrible. I changed my room after 3 days struggling with the AC. The other AC was a little better. I got to know other people staying at different Hotels, and they all had the same complaint. So that's something common. The reception was helpful and polite. The location is very good, cause you have access to everything: shops, bus station, underground, restaurants, etc. Breakfast was fine. The Hotel is quiet inside, although the surrounding area is very crowded and busy. All in all, it's moderate in everything, but its rate is a bit high for a 3 star Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 stars hotel but still not as horrible as mentioned in some reviews”
Reviews.Author: travellerCairo
Reviews.Content: well, we cannot say that this hotel deserves a 4 stars, but still it is a very nice 3 stars hotels. The room was modest but it was clean, actually you will not need more than that for a trip with friends, but of course i don't recommend at all for honeymooners! However, it is important to mention that all hotels in Istanbul are old and over-rated, so this is the case with all the 4 stars hotels & even the 5 stars hotels. The breakfast was very delicious and there was a big variety of delicious food offered. The staff is friendly but they are not very good in English, but this is the case with most of the Turkish people. The location is great, near everything. Please do not leave any valued belongings like money or expensive jewlery outside the safe box when you go out of the room.

Reviews.Title: “3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: nikolakisx
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a 3 not 4 star hotel. Good accomodation and breaksfast, but hotel is in a very noisy location due to its proximity to tacsim square. Even rooms at the back overlooking bosphorus are noisy at nite.

Reviews.Title: “Improvable comfort”
Reviews.Author: Steirerbub
Reviews.Content: Pro's: very close to Taksim square and Istiklal Cad., nice view from the restaurant to the Bosphorus, very good and comprehensive breakfast (turkish + american style), price Con's: Air condition in the room was poor, obviously no AC in the lobby and the restaurant. WLAN in the room was not working, only in the lobby. Noise from the street. Outside the hot season (when AC will not be necessary) I would recommend this hotel to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Worst 4 star hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Bera09
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of my worst life experiences. The service was substandard, the rooms were dirty, creepy and tiny. The walls were paper thin you can hear the guest next door urinating and flushing the toilet!!!! Ofcourse the air conditioner was really bad, leaking water and so noisy I was not able to sleep easily. Also the hotel owner is extremely cheap, neon lamps are used in the reception and the corridors between the rooms are always dark unless there is someone is moving out there. The only teeny tiny advantage of this hellhole is its location near Istiklal street. However the hotel itself is in a small unpleasant street. I strongly do NOT recommend this hotel to anyone and I wonder by which standard it was rated 4 stars!!!

Reviews.Title: “it's a nightmare, it's not 4-star hotel it was not up to one star”
Reviews.Author: sveit
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I lived in my life, the rooms smelled bad, furniture and carpets invalid and very old Need to be changed, the strange thing is that bathwater rusted I think the pipe is rust, Air conditioner noises wake you during sleep,the heating system does not work, when you complain no one cares,You can not hear the word courtesy or welcome from hotel staff ,as well as the receptionist, who is generally more morose. one of the reception staff Try to sell me mobile SMS at a higher price than usual, when I refused to buy from him , the answer has become I do not know whenever I asked him something. During breakfast you will notice that the ants eat with you at the same table. Had breakfast once at this hotel, although I have lived in it with 7 days,I could not leave this hell because all the hotels that i had been contacted , There are no rooms are available .I have not tried eating any meal at the hotel after what I saw at breakfast. No one helps you to carry the bags, your bag should carry yourself, do not try to ask assistance from staff of the hotel because they will exploit you . The first time in my life heard of a hotel make the heavy maintenance work during the presence of hotel guests, you hear the noise and cracking and heavy drill works, when you complain they say it is in the building next door Write these notes, so that no one in this nightmare, yes, it's a nightmare, it's not 4-star hotel it was not up to one star

Reviews.Title: “Awful,stay away”
Reviews.Author: Sanif
Reviews.Content: 1) Rude staffs 2) They do not offer u all the services they must 3) Not a 4star, only a 2 star 4) You can not relax & have a calm sleep in this hotel (Noise from street will disturb you, all the night you will bother by car horns & ambulances sirens) 5) You can find better hotels with better prices in other places in istanbul so dont rush for booking this one

Reviews.Title: “Honestly, Dont Go there.”
Reviews.Author: SamiJordan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the worst, i have read the reviews and complaints about it before i go, (just like you are doing right now) and i said to my self " some spoiled people exaggerating". eventhough this hotel is relevantly expensive compared to better hotel in the area it is aufull! everything, the location, the cleanliness, the attitude.., you name it. 1- the location is in taksim, right, but in a very narrow street and the bus cant reach the door, so we had to take the bags on foot 200m to reach the entrance. 2-we reserved a kingsize bed, and they gave us two small beds, " thats all we have take it or leave it" 3- the furniture is like 1965, they even had an in-table-radio, not working of course. 4- the AC is broken, and when we asked to fix it, they simply sent us a FAN, we said we dont want a fan, and they left us without nothing. 4- i have seen some bad hotels, i even slept in a 1 star hotel, but this is the first hotel where the water is cut and stopped while you take a shower. 5- i woke up at night to find BED BUGS in my bed sucking my blood. i never told my wife about it, or should make us sleep in the street rather than in the hotel. take my advice, and dont go there, and when you reach Istanbul, try to go and check it out for your self, and thank god you did not stay there.

Reviews.Title: “You will enjoy it!”
Reviews.Author: EnjoyTrip2008
Reviews.Content: It is an acceptable hotel, for those who want to enjoy their time searching around Istanbul and not staying all the time in hotel, Helpful and polite receptions and people who work there, very good location, you have access to many places and shops, next to bus station and underground,a small but nice restaurant with a view of Bosphore to have breakfast, rooms are cleaned every day, furnitures are average, or a bit old, breakfast is fine, So... for whom they know how they can enjoy their time and dont plan to stay all the time in hotel it is a good choice, Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “For the location only!”
Reviews.Author: davidjan
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is its location. I satayd too nights but u couldn't sleep: the windos are not double galse and its like sleeping in the midle of the street and the price is high for a low quality. The satff is not rude but very slow : it took one hour to get the room ready and i have booked 2 weeks befor going there. The other good thing is that you there is two good reastaurant nearby: Haji Baba which is a turkish reastaurant and a an excellenet japaness restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “They know nothing about Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: SalibaLebanon
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Marble Hotel for 4 nights, it was extremly the worse hotel that i've ever seen in my life. Below is the checklist: 1-Unqualified personnel, noone ever smile as if someone is dead, arrogant, never try to help you, they don't even bother to answer you when you talk. ( the reception guy named Dimish should not be working in hospitality, maybe he can be in a farm or something like this) 2- Dirty Rooms, no one clean my room for 4 days, room# 303, never change my towels, shampoo ( i had to buy my own shampoo....) 3- They tried to foul us by giving us another room which is not the same one that we booked over the internet. (i bookek for a dbl room, honey moon package, sea view: they gave me a single room, no view, fit only for a half human being, dirty full of ants and dust) 4- cats in the restaurant, very dirty plates and cuttlery in the breakfast restaurant actually the list still to go for more points, but they don't even deserve to spend time talking about their premises. A matter of fact, if you were planning to visit Turkey make sure you never ever book in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Save your vacation, stay away”
Reviews.Author: goodolympian
Reviews.Content: Cons: 1. The most dirty hotel I remember! You could see the dirt almost everywhere. 2. Hotel was on extra-extra electricity saving plan which meant very low light (near darkness) in all shared areas. 3. As another electricity saving measure they have cut air conditioning and rooms are extra hot even with highest AC on. You can't stay inside the room for more than few minutes. Hotel lobby is hot too. 4. Staff would almost always say no to you whatever the quwstion is. 5. Strangly hotel does not pur napkins in rooms! There is toilet paper but no napkin and staff confirmed that is the policy. 6. Close to busy street and noisy with no view if you have stayed in their standard rooms (not their good view rooms). Pros: 1. Close to Taksim area. 2. Cheap. 3. Wireless internet if you have laptop. 4. Fair breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but...”
Reviews.Author: bucsonice
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at the Marble in late June, at the end of a 2 1/2 week trip to Turkey. The best thing about the Marble is its location, just a short walk from Taksim Square and many restaurants. The hotel has a large lobby area and a bar. The breakfast, which is served on the first floor, has a good selection of continental breakfast items. The breakfast room also has great views of the Bosphorous. Finally, WiFi is free but seemed to be off-and-on at times. All of these things are nice, but the rooms are where guests will spend most of their time at the hotel, and the rooms at the Marble look like something from the 1960s. The furniture is worn, and the door to my room had to be pushed hard to get it to open more than a crack. My room did not have much of a view, which was OK. However, the air conditioning system was inadequate. I understand that many hotels do not have A/C, but this one advertises it and has a thermostat on the wall. Therefore, I expected some cooling, especially with temperatures in Istanbul reaching 30C. The A/C had about the same impact on the room temperature as leaving the fridge door open. To make matters worse, the staff were inconsistent. Two days before I checked out, I requested a late departure (2:00 p.m.). I realize that a request like this cannot be guaranteed, and I was grateful when the clerk at the front desk said "It will not be a problem" and typed a note into the computer. The morning of checkout, I went to the front desk and confirmed the 2:00 p.m. departure, and a different clerk said "That is not possible." When I told him that a different clerk had confirmed that it was OK, he said "What was his name?" and denied that there was any note in my record. This could be a much better hotel with a slight upgrade to the rooms, better A/C, and a retraining for a few staff members. As it is, it is a 2-star hotel in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “"Marble Motel 7***"”
Reviews.Author: Boss23
Reviews.Content: If you are booking for istanbul dont make the mistake of looking how many stars it has. If this was located in America it would be a 1 1/2 * hotel. First of all the air condition didn't work, we found bugs inside the bed and the lobby did nothing about it. We found our bathroom full of ants. After 2 days a bug bit me while i was sleeping on my foot. Once i woke up my whole foot was swollen. I went to the front desk and they did nothing about it. Not only that the water would sometimes shut off while you are taking a shower and they would only change the bed sheets ever other day. The only good thing was the location, but there are plenty of other hotels on the street. After the 4th day we left and slept the last 2 days at mayanmar because of the filth.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Pharmacist2
Reviews.Content: Although I read some of the reviews before booking this hotel I thought I would stay here anyway considering it claimed to be a 4 * hotel. Having paid a reasonable sum for the package I was very diasppointed with the standards (or lack of) in this hotel. The highlight was the beautiful view of the Bosphorus, however most other features in the room left a lot to be desired. The furniture was old, bed uncomfortable, aged carpet, ancient small tv (that we had to call an engineer to fix), the air conditioning was broken, the minibar empty, and the bathroom really looked shoddy, very small, broken toilet seat, only shampoo and hand soap provided (no shower gel or conditioner). Also it felt like we were next door to the laundry room (we werent) as there was this continual sound of a washing machine! Please don't be attracted by the swimming pool or sauna/ turkish bath facilities like i was- it looked like no one had used it or cleaned it in months. I certainly did not use these facilities

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4*, but not too bad...”
Reviews.Author: multivita
Reviews.Content: We had to choose between a room with separate beds and Bosphorus view and a room with a twin bed and street view. We chose twin bed..The room was really small, smallest on the floor, furniture old, but bathroom nice and new. But the only real problem was that we had trouble sleeping because of the trafic noise, sirens all night... We managed to changet he room after 3 nights, and got a room with a Bosphorus view, but separate beds-cant be put together! The room was better biger, and no noise. Breakfast are ok, I dont know why some people hear complain, and you have a Bosphorus view and seagales... The pool is ok, newer crowded, warm water... Hotel lobby, restaurant look better then the rooms. Location is great, Taxim, near Istiklal street. If you are lucky enough to get a quite room, and not expect 4* hotel,it is ok to book Marble hotel. I think the price is not high, not like in real 4* hotels. One of the receptionists was kind-younger and more hair, and othe other one rood.

Reviews.Title: “Lose your marbles”
Reviews.Author: datamgmtUK
Reviews.Content: This is the worst 4* hotel I have ever stayed in. All rooms are smoking. The hotel said that the only quiet rooms from road noise were at the back of the hotel - no problem, but after getting one of the rooms (604) all I had was noise from the lift as it went up and down. Eventually I moved to a room at the front (512) because it was quieter. The shower in the room intermittantly gushes brown water so taking a shower is a risk. The wireless lan is 'broken' and the fixtures and fittings decrepid - an aweful hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MANCHESTERSCOUSER
Reviews.Content: I made a prior booking and arrived at the hotel to be greeted by an extremely helpful gentleman on reception who greeted me personnally by my name. I arrived late so I was probably their only outstanding guest, however, it was nice to be dealt with in such a nice way. I was given a room at the back of the hotel, which was nice and quiet, with a beautiful view overlooking the Bosphorus. I spent 4 nights at the hotel and the entire bedding was changed every day. It was so nice to have new crisp sheets each night. The rooms are probably in need of modernisation, and although I wouldn't rate the hotel as 4 Star, it probably has been in the past & for the price it was acceptable to me. There was a small fridge in my room which was very useful to keep drinks cold. Breakfast was a little boring with not much variety, however, everything was fresh and suited me fine. The location of the hotel is excellent for everything - very close to Taskim Square. I can't praise the hotel staff enough for their kindness and friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not recommended”
Reviews.Author: omgy
Reviews.Content: Considering Marble hotel as a 4* hotel, surely it doesnâ€™t deserve it. The Hotel has a good location (near the Istiklal Street) but you can find many other hotels in the same street. We had a room with a view on the main street so it was really noisy. Rooms are small, single and double rooms are the same with two little beds. The mini bar was always empty. The fitted carpet was dirty. The air conditioning was noisy and you canâ€™t sleep until your turn it off. They didn't make any replacement for the soap and other utilities. No variety on the daily breakfast with no big choice. We asked for some drinks in the lobby (whiskey) and they only had J&B. Finally the staff was barely friendly and inflexible. I donâ€™t recommend this hotel by any mean.

Reviews.Title: “Marble Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Houbie
Reviews.Content: The main advantage to the Marble Hotel is its proximity to Taksim Square and the main shopping and nightlife street of Istiklal. The hotel has a sauna and swimming pool, but we never visited them as Istanbul was too exciting to spend time in the hotel unnecessarily. There are two types of rooms, ones that look over the Bosphorous and others that overlook a main street. As we had booked a package, we got the main street which could be quite nosiy...especially if you are on a lower level and a light sleeper (no double glazing to be had here). The rooms are a little tight, definitely no room for any extra beds. In general the place in clean. There were a few problems with the AC and the room keys at times, and the TV needed to be smacked every now and then in order to get any sound. However, for two girls sharing a room, there was definitely not enough closet space, drawers or hangers to accommodate all our attire. So new shopping got thrown around the room along with the old. Breakfast was monotonous as the same plates were served up every morning and they were not that exciting, however the view from the breakfast room more than made up for any lack of variety. Overall, a decent enough hotel which I would visit again, if you want something safe and clean, as ultimately you don't spend that much time in the hotel anyway when Istanbul has so much to offer and more...

HotelInfo.Name: Marble Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Syraselviler Cad. No:41, Taksim, Istanbul 80090, Turkey
